{"step_by_step_thinking": "Prematurity in edge to edge position refers to the condition where the upper and lower teeth meet directly in a vertical alignment, which is not a normal occlusion. This can cause discomfort and problems with biting and chewing. The prematurity can be relieved by reducing the mandibular incisal edge, which is the biting edge of the lower teeth, or the maxillary lingual fossa, which is the concave part of the upper teeth facing the tongue. Therefore, both options A and B can be used to relieve the prematurity.", "answer_choice": "C. Both AB"}
